title: By the King a proclamation for restraint of killing, dressing, and eating of flesh in Lent, or on fish daies, appointed by the law to be hereafter strictly obserued by all sorts of people
author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1603-1625 : James I)
publisher: By Bonham Norton and Iohn Bill, Printers to the Kings most Excellent Maiestie,
notes: Sheet one has arms without "I R", at top, and line 11 of text begins "daies".
"Giuen at Our Court at Newmarket the seauenth day of February, in the two and twentieth yeere of Our Reigne of great Britaine, France and Ireland."
Reproduction of original in: Society of Antiquaries.
